summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 discussing the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI) Attorney General's civil RICO lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate. Attorney Russell Pate, who worked on the complaint, emails numerous victim attorneys to coordinate strategies, praise the USVI AG's actions, and offer assistance, including potential joint mediations and victim interviews with USVI investigators.

connections.description: Pate emails Pottinger (and many others) about the USVI lawsuit; Pottinger forwards the email and states he will make contact with Pate.
Both are on the email chain regarding coordination of Epstein victim claims and the USVI lawsuit.
Pate states he used Feinberg as a mediator on a previous large settlement in the Virgin Islands.
Pate includes Allred in his mass email to numerous Epstein victim attorneys to propose coordinated legal strategies.

events.title: USVI Files Civil RICO Case Against Epstein Estate
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General files a civil RICO lawsuit against the estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Proposed Sailing Charter Trip
events.description: Russell Pate mentions a pre-paid sailing catamaran charter through the British Virgin Islands to Anegada, offering an extra cabin to other attorneys and their significant others.

keyFacts: The U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General filed a civil RICO lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate on or around January 15, 2020.
Attorney Russell Pate claims to have worked as private counsel on the USVI complaint for the four months preceding its filing.
The USVI Attorney General is described as being 'very concerned about assisting/helping the victims' and is seeking to interview victims who were trafficked to the Virgin Islands.
Russell Pate proposes coordinated legal strategies and joint mediations among the numerous attorneys representing Epstein's victims to settle claims against the estate.
Pate suggests Ken Feinberg as a potential mediator, referencing a previous nine-figure settlement in the VI where Feinberg was used.
